availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry E. Shawhan (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph Ewalt Shawhan. Married Sarah Culp Shawhan in Pike County, Missouri on October 19, 1859. Father of Joseph W Shawhan, Hubbard W. Shawhan, Sarah E. Shawhan, Sarah M. Shawhan, Margaret R. Shawhan, Cynthia A. Shawhan, and Ann E. Shawhan. Married to Sarah Pugh “Sallie” Cantrill Shawhan in Harrison County, Kentucky c. 1850. Married Sarah Culp Shawhan in Pike County, Missouri on October 19, 1859. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Harrison County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in Harrison County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
